page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content:
HOUSING
Housing in the block is very limited. There is one row of houses built on Queens Road. (O.S.Ref. TA 200148) Out of a total of 18 houses, 7 are now lived in and the rest are derelict. The houses were built pre 1930 to serve the needs of the dock workers. Nearby was the terminus of the electric tramway that brought the workers from Grimsby. The tramway was brought into use in 1912 with the Queens Road extension opened in 1913. The tramway closed in 1961 and the last trams were second hand stock from Gateshead. A regular bus service made the houses unnecessary and it is unlikely that they will ever be renovated.
